question: Which among the following is the primary difference between a free trade area and a customs union?
option1: members of a free trade area adopt a common set of barriers for trade between the members
option2: a free trade area is considered a trade bloc and a customs union is not
option3: members of a customs union adopt a common set of external trade barriers
option4: a free trade area can include parts of a country and a customs union includes entire countries
answer: members of a customs union adopt a common set of external trade barriers
